overview:
Dr. Assaf Morag has been involved in entrepreneurship and enterprise software for the past 25 years.

Before joining TOA, he led the worldwide introduction of the â€™Mobile Clinical Assistantâ€™ for Intel Corpâ€™s Digital Health Group. In 1992, Dr. Morag co-founded and led Pegasus Medical, which developed software for digitizing patient records. When Pegasus was sold to HBOC (today McKesson) in 1995, Dr. Morag stayed with HBOC for 4 years as an Executive VP. He left HBOC to become co-founder and CEO of Healinx, an online service that connects patients, physicians and pharmacies. Dr. Morag has an MD from Ben-Gurion University in Israel and an MBA from Santa Clara University.
